posts.cooked: Live location sharing is a feature that WhatsApp and Telegram support. You can select to share your location for a specified amount of time (e.g. 15 or 30 minutes) with a user or a group and it will continuosly update your location and display it to them on a map. Also works with several users, who are all displayed on the same map. Very useful to find your friends in a crowd. It would be nice if Signal would get this feature, too.

link_counts.title: Contacts refuse to use Signal because it lacks many things
Live location of me and my contact on a little map during video or phone call
Share multiple locations or a route
How can Signal be better for communities and organisers?
Attach multiple contacts to a message
Ability for group admins to delete any message for everyone
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 6.10 release

posts.name: Alexander Sibert
posts.cooked:
I wish this feature too but better in UI than WhatsApp. On WhatsApp if you send live location sharing it show the small map inside message area but if you type after it with your contacts messages the map goes to top like all other elements inside.

So perfect would be if you can see on Signal everytime (UI) the live location map for example if you write a lot with your contacts. So map will be displayed on top or bottom of message area anywhere where you can see always current location. After a while it can scroll in but you can tap this featue to see current location.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: Lets not call it easy. Besides, the location has to be displayed on a map. We don’t exactly want to add Google maps here do we.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
Meteor0id:

We don’t exactly want to add Google maps here do we.

Signal already uses Google Maps for sharing a single location, but with their recent price increase there has been some discussion if that should remain so.

Having used this in WA, I find it extremely useful even for the very very few occasions where one may have/want to use it, I’d love to see this in Signal.

Could one way to reduce the Maps pinging be to not share constantly (or share it but in sparse intervals) but to make location available so if the other party wants to check my location, they can request it and Signal can then send it to them on request?

posts.name: Gl U79z
posts.cooked:
Isn’t it possible to use OSM instead?

Besides the question of the map provider I really would like to have a feature like live location sharing. There are not many apps I would trust with my live location. And when there is one, nobody of my friends is using it.

posts.name: Yotz
posts.cooked:
You don’t need to send the map location constantly from the person sharing his location.
The location should be sent only when the receiver(s) looks in the map. While the map is open on the receiver’s end, it will periodically (not too often) request the location directly from the sender.

I also use whatsapp for this, but I don’t trust them with my data. I neither trust any of the other location sharing apps. Signal is the only app I’d trust with my live location.

posts.name: Ryan Vettese
posts.cooked: I just went to try to do this in Signal and it doesn’t do this. I would love it if it could. I just convinced about 30 people to switch from WhatsApp and we use this functionality a lot.

posts.name: Cptcotton
posts.cooked: I’d love to use live location sharing, too.

I have no idea if the same thing is feasible with Signal, but the OpenStreetMap-based app OSMAnd came up with a pretty novel solution using Telegram for location sharing:

osmand.net – 14 Sep 18

Online GPS Tracker release | OsmAnd

We are pleased to announce that we have a new application in OsmAnd family. This application helps to see your contacts on the map in OsmAnd. It has a social aspect; you need to have contacts, that's why it was challenging for us to choose the...

posts.name: Sai Naung
posts.cooked: I’ve been using Signal for about 3 months now. I enjoyed it so much. Today, I will switch to WhatsApp again because Live Location is essential for me. I will switch back to Signal when this feature is available.
My solution was to just use Google Maps when I needed someones live location. It would be cool if this was a feature in Signal though.

posts.name: grebulon
posts.cooked: I signed in only to suggest this feature. Glad to see that I’m not the only one requesting this.

This only works for Android users with Google Play Services. I’m using an OS without this, and I use OSM instead.

I would appreciate it if y’all could either:

  1. switch to OSM
  2. add an option to use OSM
  3. add an option to share a standard geo: link that users can open in whatever map app they use, instead of adhering strictly to Google Maps.

Are any of these things feasible?

Live sharing and using OSM are technically two different features. Please post to the thread which deals specifically with OSM

Use OpenStreetMap instead of Google Maps Feature Requests
When sending a location I noticed that Google Maps was used for selecting locations. Isn’t it true that Google tracks behaviour like searching/selecting locations? Let’s suppose you want to secretly meet up with someone, Signal will provide the privacy for that. However, if you select it though Google Maps, Google knows you selected that location. Plus, if the other person clicks that same link, Google might figure out that you will be meeting with that person at that location. Damn, this sou…

BTW, there’s a pull request where Moxie states what they need to enable OSM

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Use OsmDroid and OpenStreetMap when Google Play Services is not available

signalapp:master ← hfjooste:master
opened 04:11PM - 26 Jun 18 UTC
hfjooste
+403 -54

Fixes #7835 ### First time contributor checklist - [x] I have read [how… to contribute](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/) ### Contributor checklist - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices: * Physical device: Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (Android 7.0) - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) ---------- ### Description I've added OsmDroid to load/display the map and allow a user to select a location. The user can also specify an optional location name and address. This is only used when the Google Play Services is not installed (or disabled). I've also replaced the Google Maps link with OpenStreetMap when the Google Play Services is not available

posts.cooked:
software2000:

I’d love to use location sharing, too.

Hello and welcome to the Signal community. Just a little hint: please respect the community guidelines.They say:

Keep It Tidy
Make the effort to put things in the right place, so that we can spend more time discussing and less cleaning up. So:
[…]
Rather than posting “+1” or “Agreed”, use the Like button.

You’ll find the “like” button () below every post. To show your vote/support for a certain feature request, it’s best to just use the like button on the opening post of that topic.

Creating “me too” or “+1” posts don’t contribute to the discussion at all, they only make it harder to follow the topic and trigger unnecessary notifications for anyone previously involved in the topic.

Thanks!

posts.name: Nirav Mehta
posts.cooked: I can share my live location link on iOS via the Google Maps app on a signal chat. Doesn’t that solve the problem?
You can even share on the Google maps app itself. That’s a good work around but not as integrated as iMessage and WhatsApps implementation of the feature.

and again…
To show your support to a feature request please hit that icon in the first post.
Bumping topics doesn’t add anything to the discussion and is against the forum guidelines
I think Signal’s priorities right now are privacy, when most privacy features are added there can be a shift to social media features.
